conclusion: Determine the time it takes for light to travel from point O to boundary AB of the trapezoid.
Refractive index of the transparent body is sqrt(2), and light enters the trapezoid at an angle of 45 degrees.
The trapezoid ABDE has a right angle at E.
The light enters the trapezoid at point O, which is on the line AE.
The angle of incidence at point O is 45 degrees.
Light is entering from air with refractive index n1 = 1 into the trapezoid with refractive index n2 = sqrt(2).
Using Snell's Law: n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2).
Substitute theta1 = 45 degrees and n1 = 1: sin(45 degrees) = sqrt(2) sin(theta2).
The light travels in a straight line from O to the boundary AB.
Angle theta2 = 30 degrees is the angle between the light path and the normal to AE inside the trapezoid.
Assume the height of the trapezoid (OE) is h.
Light travels along the hypotenuse of a right triangle with angle 30 degrees and opposite side h.
Calculate distance d traveled by the light: d = h/sin(30 degrees) = h/0.5 = 2h.
Speed of light in the medium is v = c/n2, where c is the speed of light in vacuum.
Calculate time t taken to travel distance d: t = d/v = 2h/(c/sqrt(2)) = 2h sqrt(2)/c.
The time t for light to travel from point O to the boundary AB is t = 2h sqrt(2)/c.
